intro: Nauclea angustifolia, commonly known as the narrow-leaf nauclea, is a flowering plant belonging to the Rubiaceae family. It is native to tropical regions of Africa and is characterized by its slender, often woody stems and opposite, narrow leaves. The plant produces small, clustered flowers that are typically white or pale pink, followed by capsule fruits containing numerous seeds. It is often found in woodland and savanna habitats, where it plays a role in local ecosystems. Nauclea angustifolia is also valued for its medicinal properties in traditional medicine.
